qas.question: According to actor Dominic Wes, would he send his children to Eton?
According to actor Tom Hiddleston, that is special about Eton?

answers.text: They champion the talent of the individual

qas.question: Which actor states there are widespread misconceptions about Eton?
Who was one of Tom Hiddleston's classmates at Eton?

plausible_answers.text: Yes, I would. It’s an extraordinary place

qas.question: What did Tom Hiddleston say about sending any potential kids to Eton?

plausible_answers.text: It isn’t true... It's actually one of the most broadminded places I’ve ever been

qas.question: What did Dominic West say about the perception of Eton being full of braying toffs?
Who was in the same House as Dominic West?

context: Actor <b3_0>Dominic West<b3_0/> has been unenthusiastic about the career benefits of being an Old Etonian, saying it "is a stigma that is slightly above 'paedophile' in the media in a gallery of infamy", but asked whether he would consider sending his own children there, said "<a0_0><b4_0>Yes, I would.<a0_0/> It’s an extraordinary place<b4_0/>... It has the facilities and the excellence of teaching and it will find what you’re good at and nurture it", while the actor <a2_0><b6_0>Tom Hiddleston<b6_0/><a2_0/> says there are widespread misconceptions about Eton, and that "People think it's just full of braying toffs... <b5_0>It isn’t true... It's actually one of the most broadminded places I’ve ever been<b5_0/>. The reason it’s a good school is that it encourages people to find the thing they love and to go for it. <a1_0>They champion the talent of the individual<a1_0/> and that’s what’s special about it".
